pr_title: config: add ability to register native filters

timeline.message:
config: add ability to register native filters

Signed-off-by: Jose Nino <jnino@lyft.com>

timeline.bodyText: nativeplatformFilterTemplateYAML shouldn't this be nativeFilterTemplateYAML? Also should be documented above because I don't think this is immediately obvious as to what should be passed here (it's a bit of a "magic" string)
timeline.author: rebello95

replies.bodyText: Can you actually elaborate on how this will be used directly? I.e., what will a consumer need to specify to make this work?
replies.author: rebello95

replies.bodyText: bad find and replace. will fix.
replies.author: junr03

timeline.bodyText: Doesn't this need an order? Two lists or a list of pairs might be a better serialization.
timeline.author: goaway

replies.bodyText: whoops, used to ordered map in c++. I agree, will fix.
replies.author: junr03

timeline.message:
ios and comments

Signed-off-by: Jose Nino <jnino@lyft.com>

timeline.author: rebello95
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -36,11 +35,13 @@
    * @param appVersion                   the App Version of the App using this Envoy Client.
    * @param appId                        the App ID of the App using this Envoy Client.
    * @param virtualClusters              the JSON list of virtual cluster configs.
+   * @param nativeFilterChain                the configuration for native filters.

timeline.bodyText: It'd be great if we could check in rst docs as well explaining how to use these
timeline.author: rebello95

replies.bodyText: these are not intended to be publicly replaced. I am guessing that @goaway added the platform string (and I copied him here) because the jni needs to be called to get the string. Vs. in objc you'll notice these are not params because objc can use the c string.
replies.author: junr03

timeline.bodyText: typedConfig seems like a bit of a misnomer throughout this PR since it's by definition untyped since it's a string.
timeline.author: rebello95

replies.bodyText: using the envoy field name for consistency
replies.author: junr03

timeline.bodyText: Is the .class file deliberately being checked in below?
